scholarship.title: Apply for IKMF Scholarship
scholarship.subtitle2: Supporting bright students from lower/vulnerable socio-economic backgrounds access secondary school education.

FAQ.question: Who can apply for the IKMF Scholarship?
FAQ.answer: Students who have completed their Kenya Junior Secondary Education Assessment (KJSEA) and are transitioning to senior secondary school. We prioritise academically promising students from low-income households, orphans, vulnerable children, and students with disabilities.

FAQ.question: What does the scholarship cover?
FAQ.answer: The scholarship covers tuition fees, school supplies, and other educational expenses.

FAQ.question: When do applications open and close?
FAQ.answer: Applications open in late December and close around the first or second week of January, depending on the release of national exam results.

FAQ.question: How does the selection process work?
FAQ.answer: Applications are reviewed based on financial need, academic merit, and supporting documents. Shortlisted applicants are invited for interviews and home visits before final decisions are made.

FAQ.question: How long does the scholarship cover?
FAQ.answer: Yes, the scholarship covers the entire three years at senior secondary, subject to academic performance, discipline, and participation in mentorship activities.

FAQ.question: How do I apply?
FAQ.answer: Visit our website in December to access the application form. Make sure to complete it and submit all required documents before the deadline.

vulnerable-group.title: Partner to improve the lives of vulnerable groups
vulnerable-group.subtitle1: Partner to improve the lives of vulnerable groups
